discos

DISCOS: DISrete COllinear Skeletonization

A Python package for 3D mesh manipulation and skeletonization of complex neuronal morphologies. Provides tools for mesh processing, segmentation, and conversion to SWC format using discrete collinear skeletonization algorithms.

 1"""
 2DISCOS: DISrete COllinear Skeletonization
 3
 4A Python package for 3D mesh manipulation and skeletonization of complex neuronal morphologies.
 5Provides tools for mesh processing, segmentation, and conversion to SWC format using discrete
 6collinear skeletonization algorithms.
 7"""
 8

class MeshManager: 
  56class MeshManager:
  57    """
  58    Unified mesh class handling loading, processing, and analysis.
  59    """
  60
  61    def __init__(self, mesh: Optional[trimesh.Trimesh] = None, verbose: bool = True):
  62        # Core mesh attributes
  63        self.mesh = mesh
  64        self.original_mesh = mesh
  65        self.bounds = self._compute_bounds()
  66
  67        # Attributes
  68        self.verbose = verbose
  69        self.stats = {
  70            "processed": 0,
  71            "successful": 0,
  72            "failed": 0,
  73            "volume_fixed": 0,
  74            "watertight_fixed": 0,
  75            "degenerate_removed": 0,
  76        }
  77
  78    def log(self, message: str, level: str = "INFO"):
  79        """Compatibility shim: delegate to module logger respecting self.verbose.
  80
  81        Levels: INFO, SUCCESS (maps to INFO), WARNING, ERROR, PROCESSING (maps to INFO)
  82        """
  83        if not self.verbose:
  84            return
  85        lvl = level.upper()
  86        if lvl in ("SUCCESS", "PROCESSING"):
  87            lvl = "INFO"
  88        if lvl == "INFO":
  89            logger.info(message)
  90        elif lvl == "WARNING":
  91            logger.warning(message)
  92        elif lvl == "ERROR":
  93            logger.error(message)
  94        else:
  95            logger.info(message)

 101    def load_mesh(
 102        self, filepath: str, file_format: Optional[str] = None
 103    ) -> trimesh.Trimesh:
 104        """
 105        Load a mesh from file.
 106
 107        Args:
 108            filepath: Path to mesh file
 109            file_format: Optional format specification (auto-detected if None)
 110
 111        Returns:
 112            Loaded trimesh object
 113        """
 114        try:
 115            if file_format:
 116                mesh = trimesh.load(filepath, file_type=file_format)
 117            else:
 118                mesh = trimesh.load(filepath)
 119
 120            # Ensure we have a single mesh
 121            if isinstance(mesh, trimesh.Scene):
 122                # If it's a scene, try to get the first geometry
 123                geometries = list(mesh.geometry.values())
 124                if geometries:
 125                    mesh = geometries[0]
 126                else:
 127                    raise ValueError("No geometry found in mesh scene")
 128
 129            if not isinstance(mesh, trimesh.Trimesh):
 130                raise ValueError(f"Loaded object is not a mesh: {type(mesh)}")
 131
 132            self.mesh = mesh
 133            self.original_mesh = mesh.copy()
 134            self.bounds = self._compute_bounds()
 135
 136            if self.verbose:
 137                logger.info(
 138                    "Loaded mesh: %d vertices, %d faces",
 139                    len(mesh.vertices),
 140                    len(mesh.faces),
 141                )
 142                logger.debug("Bounds: %s", self.bounds)
 143
 144            return mesh
 145
 146        except Exception as e:
 147            raise ValueError(f"Failed to load mesh from {filepath}: {str(e)}")
 148
 149    def save(self, filepath, file_format="obj"):
 150        self.mesh.export(filepath, file_type=file_format)
 151
 152    def copy(self):
 153        return MeshManager(self.mesh.copy(), verbose=self.verbose)
 154
 155    def to_trimesh(self):
 156        return self.mesh
 157
 158    def _compute_bounds(self) -> Optional[Dict[str, Tuple[float, float]]]:
 159        """Compute mesh bounding box."""
 160        if self.mesh is None:
 161            return None
 162
 163        min_coords = self.mesh.vertices.min(axis=0)
 164        max_coords = self.mesh.vertices.max(axis=0)
 165
 166        return {
 167            "x": (min_coords[0], max_coords[0]),
 168            "y": (min_coords[1], max_coords[1]),
 169            "z": (min_coords[2], max_coords[2]),
 170        }
 171
 172    def get_z_range(self) -> Tuple[float, float]:
 173        """Get the z-axis range of the mesh."""
 174        if self.bounds is None:
 175            raise ValueError("No mesh loaded")
 176        return self.bounds["z"]
 177
 178    def center_mesh(self, center_on: str = "centroid") -> trimesh.Trimesh:
 179        """
 180        Center the mesh.
 181
 182        Args:
 183            center_on: 'centroid', 'bounds_center', or 'origin'
 184
 185        Returns:
 186            Centered mesh
 187        """
 188        if self.mesh is None:
 189            raise ValueError("No mesh loaded")
 190
 191        if center_on == "centroid":
 192            center = self.mesh.centroid
 193        elif center_on == "bounds_center":
 194            center = self.mesh.bounds.mean(axis=0)
 195        elif center_on == "origin":
 196            center = np.array([0, 0, 0])
 197        else:
 198            raise ValueError(f"Unknown center_on option: {center_on}")
 199
 200        self.mesh.vertices -= center
 201        self.bounds = self._compute_bounds()
 202
 203        return self.mesh
 204
 205    def scale_mesh(self, scale_factor: float) -> trimesh.Trimesh:
 206        """
 207        Scale the mesh uniformly.
 208
 209        Args:
 210            scale_factor: Scaling factor
 211
 212        Returns:
 213            Scaled mesh
 214        """
 215        if self.mesh is None:
 216            raise ValueError("No mesh loaded")
 217
 218        self.mesh.vertices *= scale_factor
 219        self.bounds = self._compute_bounds()
 220
 221        return self.mesh
 222
 223    def align_with_z_axis(
 224        self, target_axis: Optional[np.ndarray] = None
 225    ) -> trimesh.Trimesh:
 226        """
 227        Align the mesh's principal axis with the z-axis.
 228
 229        Args:
 230            target_axis: Target direction (default: [0, 0, 1])
 231
 232        Returns:
 233            Aligned mesh
 234        """
 235        if self.mesh is None:
 236            raise ValueError("No mesh loaded")
 237
 238        if target_axis is None:
 239            target_axis = np.array([0, 0, 1])
 240
 241        # Compute principal axis using PCA
 242        vertices_centered = self.mesh.vertices - self.mesh.centroid
 243        covariance = np.cov(vertices_centered.T)
 244        eigenvalues, eigenvectors = np.linalg.eigh(covariance)
 245
 246        # Principal axis is the eigenvector with largest eigenvalue
 247        principal_axis = eigenvectors[:, np.argmax(eigenvalues)]
 248
 249        # Compute rotation to align principal axis with target
 250        rotation_matrix = self._rotation_matrix_between_vectors(
 251            principal_axis, target_axis
 252        )
 253
 254        # Apply rotation
 255        self.mesh.vertices = (
 256            rotation_matrix @ vertices_centered.T
 257        ).T + self.mesh.centroid
 258        self.bounds = self._compute_bounds()
 259
 260        return self.mesh
 261
 262    def _rotation_matrix_between_vectors(
 263        self, vec1: np.ndarray, vec2: np.ndarray
 264    ) -> np.ndarray:
 265        """Compute rotation matrix to rotate vec1 to vec2."""
 266        # Normalize vectors
 267        vec1 = vec1 / np.linalg.norm(vec1)
 268        vec2 = vec2 / np.linalg.norm(vec2)
 269
 270        # Check if vectors are already aligned
 271        if np.allclose(vec1, vec2):
 272            return np.eye(3)
 273        if np.allclose(vec1, -vec2):
 274            # 180-degree rotation - find perpendicular axis
 275            perp = np.array([1, 0, 0]) if abs(vec1[0]) < 0.9 else np.array([0, 1, 0])
 276            axis = np.cross(vec1, perp)
 277            axis = axis / np.linalg.norm(axis)
 278            return self._rodrigues_rotation(axis, np.pi)
 279
 280        # General case using Rodrigues' formula
 281        axis = np.cross(vec1, vec2)
 282        axis = axis / np.linalg.norm(axis)
 283        angle = np.arccos(np.clip(np.dot(vec1, vec2), -1, 1))
 284
 285        return self._rodrigues_rotation(axis, angle)
 286
 287    def _rodrigues_rotation(self, axis: np.ndarray, angle: float) -> np.ndarray:
 288        """Rodrigues' rotation formula."""
 289        K = np.array(
 290            [[0, -axis[2], axis[1]], [axis[2], 0, -axis[0]], [-axis[1], axis[0], 0]]
 291        )
 292        return np.eye(3) + np.sin(angle) * K + (1 - np.cos(angle)) * K @ K
 293
 294    def _furthest_pair(self, points: np.ndarray) -> Tuple[int, int, np.ndarray]:
 295        """Return indices (i,j) of a furthest-apart pair and the vector points[j]-points[i]."""
 296        best_i = 0
 297        best_j = 1 if points.shape[0] > 1 else 0
 298        best_d2 = -1.0
 299        n = points.shape[0]
 300        for i in range(n - 1):
 301            diffs = points[i + 1 :] - points[i]
 302            if diffs.size == 0:
 303                continue
 304            d2 = np.einsum("ij,ij->i", diffs, diffs)
 305            if d2.size == 0:
 306                continue
 307            j_rel = int(np.argmax(d2))
 308            if d2[j_rel] > best_d2:
 309                best_d2 = float(d2[j_rel])
 310                best_i = i
 311                best_j = i + 1 + j_rel
 312        v = points[best_j] - points[best_i]
 313        return best_i, best_j, v
 314
 315    def align_furthest_points_with_z(
 316        self,
 317        *,
 318        prefer_positive_z: bool = True,
 319        use_convex_hull: bool = True,
 320    ) -> trimesh.Trimesh:
 321        """
 322        Orient the mesh so the vector between the two furthest-apart points
 323        aligns with the +Z axis.
 324
 325        This computes a diameter of the point set (by default using the convex
 326        hull vertices for efficiency), finds the pair of points with maximum
 327        Euclidean distance, and rotates the mesh about its centroid so that
 328        this vector is aligned with the positive z-axis.
 329
 330        Args:
 331            prefer_positive_z: If True, align the diameter to +Z; otherwise the
 332                orientation to Z is arbitrary up to a sign.
 333            use_convex_hull: If True (default), compute the diameter over the
 334                convex hull vertices. This is typically much smaller than the
 335                full vertex set and yields the same diameter for convex sets.
 336
 337        Returns:
 338            The rotated mesh (also stored in self.mesh).
 339        """
 340        if self.mesh is None:
 341            raise ValueError("No mesh loaded")
 342
 343        # Select candidate points
 344        try:
 345            points = (
 346                self.mesh.convex_hull.vertices
 347                if use_convex_hull and hasattr(self.mesh, "convex_hull")
 348                else self.mesh.vertices
 349            )
 350        except Exception:
 351            points = self.mesh.vertices
 352
 353        points = np.asarray(points, dtype=float)
 354        if points.shape[0] < 2:
 355            # Nothing to do
 356            return self.mesh
 357
 358        # Find furthest pair using a vectorized per-anchor pass (O(n^2) time, O(n) mem)
 359        best_i = 0
 360        best_j = 1
 361        best_d2 = -1.0
 362        n = points.shape[0]
 363        for i in range(n - 1):
 364            diffs = points[i + 1 :] - points[i]
 365            if diffs.size == 0:
 366                continue
 367            d2 = np.einsum("ij,ij->i", diffs, diffs)
 368            j_rel = int(np.argmax(d2))
 369            if d2[j_rel] > best_d2:
 370                best_d2 = float(d2[j_rel])
 371                best_i = i
 372                best_j = i + 1 + j_rel
 373
 374        p1 = points[best_i]
 375        p2 = points[best_j]
 376        v = p2 - p1
 377        norm = float(np.linalg.norm(v))
 378        if not np.isfinite(norm) or norm <= 1e-12:
 379            # Degenerate case; nothing to rotate
 380            return self.mesh
 381
 382        if prefer_positive_z and v[2] < 0:
 383            v = -v
 384
 385        # Compute rotation from v to +Z
 386        target = np.array([0.0, 0.0, 1.0], dtype=float)
 387        R = self._rotation_matrix_between_vectors(v, target)
 388
 389        # Rotate about centroid to preserve position
 390        centroid = self.mesh.centroid
 391        vc = self.mesh.vertices - centroid
 392        self.mesh.vertices = (R @ vc.T).T + centroid
 393        self.bounds = self._compute_bounds()
 394
 395        # Post-rotation correction: compute the furthest pair on the rotated
 396        # vertices and ensure that vector is aligned with +Z as well. This
 397        # guards against cases where the exact furthest pair differs slightly
 398        # from the one chosen for the initial rotation.
 399        try:
 400            all_pts = np.asarray(self.mesh.vertices, dtype=float)
 401            if all_pts.shape[0] >= 2:
 402                _, _, v2 = self._furthest_pair(all_pts)
 403                if prefer_positive_z and v2[2] < 0:
 404                    v2 = -v2
 405                v2n = v2 / (np.linalg.norm(v2) + 1e-12)
 406                if v2n[2] < 0.999:
 407                    R2 = self._rotation_matrix_between_vectors(v2, target)
 408                    vc2 = self.mesh.vertices - centroid
 409                    self.mesh.vertices = (R2 @ vc2.T).T + centroid
 410                    self.bounds = self._compute_bounds()
 411        except Exception:
 412            # If anything goes wrong, we keep the initial rotation which already
 413            # aligns the chosen diameter to +Z.
 414            pass
 415
 416        return self.mesh
 417

 419
 420    def analyze_mesh(self) -> dict:
 421        """
 422        Analyze and return mesh properties for diagnostic purposes.
 423        This function performs pure analysis without modifying the input mesh.
 424
 425        Returns:
 426            Dictionary of mesh properties including volume, watertightness, winding consistency,
 427            face count, vertex count, bounds, and potential issues.
 428        """
 429
 430        mesh = self.to_trimesh()
 431        # Initialize results dictionary
 432        results = {
 433            "face_count": len(mesh.faces),
 434            "vertex_count": len(mesh.vertices),
 435            "bounds": mesh.bounds.tolist() if hasattr(mesh, "bounds") else None,
 436            "is_watertight": mesh.is_watertight,
 437            "is_winding_consistent": mesh.is_winding_consistent,
 438            "issues": [],
 439        }
 440
 441        # Calculate volume (report actual value, even if negative)
 442        try:
 443            results["volume"] = mesh.volume
 444            if mesh.volume < 0:
 445                results["issues"].append(
 446                    "Negative volume detected - face normals may be inverted"
 447                )
 448        except Exception as e:
 449            results["volume"] = None
 450            results["issues"].append(f"Volume calculation failed: {str(e)}")
 451
 452        # Check for non-manifold edges
 453        try:
 454            if hasattr(mesh, "is_manifold"):
 455                results["is_manifold"] = mesh.is_manifold
 456                if not mesh.is_manifold:
 457                    results["issues"].append("Non-manifold edges detected")
 458        except Exception:
 459            results["is_manifold"] = None
 460
 461        # Calculate topological properties using trimesh's built-in methods
 462        try:
 463            # Use trimesh's built-in euler_number property for correct topology calculation
 464            # For a sphere: euler_number = 2
 465            # For a torus: euler_number = 0
 466            # For a double torus: euler_number = -2
 467            # Genus = (2 - euler_number) / 2
 468
 469            results["euler_characteristic"] = mesh.euler_number
 470
 471            # Only calculate genus for closed (watertight) meshes
 472            if mesh.is_watertight:
 473                # For a closed orientable surface: genus = (2 - euler_number) / 2
 474                results["genus"] = int((2 - mesh.euler_number) / 2)
 475
 476                # Sanity check - genus should be non-negative for simple shapes
 477                if results["genus"] < 0:
 478                    results["genus"] = (
 479                        0  # Default to 0 for simple shapes like spheres, cylinders
 480                    )
 481                    results["issues"].append(
 482                        "Calculated negative genus, defaulting to 0"
 483                    )
 484            else:
 485                # For non-watertight meshes, genus is not well-defined
 486                results["genus"] = None
 487                results["issues"].append("Genus undefined for non-watertight mesh")
 488        except Exception as e:
 489            results["genus"] = None
 490            results["euler_characteristic"] = None
 491            results["issues"].append(f"Topology calculation failed: {str(e)}")
 492
 493        # Analyze face normals
 494        try:
 495            if hasattr(mesh, "face_normals") and mesh.face_normals is not None:
 496                # Get statistics on face normal directions
 497                results["normal_stats"] = {
 498                    "mean": mesh.face_normals.mean(axis=0).tolist(),
 499                    "std": mesh.face_normals.std(axis=0).tolist(),
 500                    "sum": mesh.face_normals.sum(axis=0).tolist(),
 501                }
 502
 503                # Check if normals are predominantly pointing inward (negative volume)
 504                if results.get("volume", 0) < 0:
 505                    results["normal_direction"] = "inward"
 506                else:
 507                    results["normal_direction"] = "outward"
 508        except Exception as e:
 509            results["normal_stats"] = None
 510            results["issues"].append(f"Normal analysis failed: {str(e)}")
 511
 512        # Check for duplicate vertices and faces
 513        try:
 514            unique_verts = np.unique(mesh.vertices, axis=0)
 515            results["duplicate_vertices"] = len(mesh.vertices) - len(unique_verts)
 516            if results["duplicate_vertices"] > 0:
 517                results["issues"].append(
 518                    f"Found {results['duplicate_vertices']} duplicate vertices"
 519                )
 520        except Exception:
 521            results["duplicate_vertices"] = None
 522
 523        # Check for degenerate faces (zero area)
 524        try:
 525            if hasattr(mesh, "area_faces"):
 526                degenerate_count = np.sum(mesh.area_faces < 1e-8)
 527                results["degenerate_faces"] = int(degenerate_count)
 528                if degenerate_count > 0:
 529                    results["issues"].append(
 530                        f"Found {degenerate_count} degenerate faces"
 531                    )
 532        except Exception:
 533            results["degenerate_faces"] = None
 534
 535        # Check for connected components
 536        try:
 537            components = mesh.split(only_watertight=False)
 538            results["component_count"] = len(components)
 539            if len(components) > 1:
 540                results["issues"].append(
 541                    f"Mesh has {len(components)} disconnected components"
 542                )
 543        except Exception:
 544            results["component_count"] = None
 545
 546        return results
 547
 548    def print_mesh_analysis(self, verbose: bool = False) -> None:
 549        """
 550        Analyze a mesh and print a formatted report of its properties.
 551
 552        Args:
 553            verbose: Whether to print detailed information
 554        """
 555        analysis = self.analyze_mesh()
 556
 557        logger.info("Mesh Analysis Report")
 558        logger.info("====================")
 559
 560        # Basic properties
 561        logger.info("\nGeometry:")
 562        logger.info("  * Vertices: %s", analysis['vertex_count'])
 563        logger.info("  * Faces: %s", analysis['face_count'])
 564        if analysis.get("component_count") is not None:
 565            logger.info("  * Components: %s", analysis['component_count'])
 566        if analysis.get("volume") is not None:
 567            logger.info("  * Volume: %.2f", analysis['volume'])
 568        if analysis.get("bounds") is not None:
 569            min_bound, max_bound = analysis["bounds"]
 570            logger.info(
 571                "  * Bounds: [%.1f, %.1f, %.1f] to [%.1f, %.1f, %.1f]",
 572                min_bound[0],
 573                min_bound[1],
 574                min_bound[2],
 575                max_bound[0],
 576                max_bound[1],
 577                max_bound[2],
 578            )
 579
 580        # Mesh quality
 581        logger.info("\nMesh Quality:")
 582        logger.info("  * Watertight: %s", analysis['is_watertight'])
 583        logger.info("  * Winding Consistent: %s", analysis['is_winding_consistent'])
 584        if analysis.get("is_manifold") is not None:
 585            logger.info("  * Manifold: %s", analysis['is_manifold'])
 586        if analysis.get("normal_direction") is not None:
 587            logger.info("  * Normal Direction: %s", analysis['normal_direction'])
 588        if analysis.get("duplicate_vertices") is not None:
 589            logger.info("  * Duplicate Vertices: %s", analysis['duplicate_vertices'])
 590        if analysis.get("degenerate_faces") is not None:
 591            logger.info("  * Degenerate Faces: %s", analysis['degenerate_faces'])
 592
 593        # Topology
 594        if (
 595            analysis.get("genus") is not None
 596            or analysis.get("euler_characteristic") is not None
 597        ):
 598            logger.info("\nTopology:")
 599            if analysis.get("genus") is not None:
 600                logger.info("  * Genus: %s", analysis['genus'])
 601            if analysis.get("euler_characteristic") is not None:
 602                logger.info("  * Euler Characteristic: %s", analysis['euler_characteristic'])
 603
 604        # Issues
 605        if analysis["issues"]:
 606            logger.info("\nIssues Detected (%d):", len(analysis['issues']))
 607            for i, issue in enumerate(analysis["issues"]):
 608                logger.info("  %d. %s", i + 1, issue)
 609        else:
 610            logger.info("\nNo issues detected")
 611
 612        # Detailed stats
 613        if verbose and analysis.get("normal_stats") is not None:
 614            logger.info("\nNormal Statistics:")
 615            mean = analysis["normal_stats"]["mean"]
 616            sum_val = analysis["normal_stats"]["sum"]
 617            logger.info("  * Mean: [%.4f, %.4f, %.4f]", mean[0], mean[1], mean[2])
 618            logger.info("  * Sum: [%.4f, %.4f, %.4f]", sum_val[0], sum_val[1], sum_val[2])
 619
 620        logger.info("\nRecommendation:")
 621        if analysis["issues"]:
 622            logger.info("  Consider using repair_mesh() to fix the detected issues.")
 623        else:
 624            logger.info("  Mesh appears to be in good condition.")
 625        logger.info("====================")
 626
 627    def repair_mesh(
 628        self,
 629        fix_holes: bool = True,
 630        remove_duplicates: bool = True,
 631        fix_normals: bool = True,
 632        remove_degenerate: bool = True,
 633        fix_negative_volume: bool = True,
 634        keep_largest_component: bool = False,
 635        verbose: bool = True,
 636    ) -> trimesh.Trimesh:
 637        """
 638        Attempt to repair common mesh issues to improve watertightness and quality.
 639
 640        Args:
 641            mesh_data: Either a Trimesh object or (vertices, faces) tuple
 642            fix_holes: Whether to attempt filling holes
 643            remove_duplicates: Whether to remove duplicate faces and vertices
 644            fix_normals: Whether to fix face normal consistency
 645            remove_degenerate: Whether to remove degenerate faces
 646            fix_negative_volume: Whether to invert faces if mesh has negative volume
 647            keep_largest_component: Whether to keep only the largest connected component
 648            verbose: Whether to print repair summary
 649
 650        Returns:
 651            Repaired mesh (new copy, original is not modified)
 652        """
 653
 654        mesh = self.to_trimesh()
 655
 656        repair_log = []
 657
 658        # Fix negative volume by inverting faces if needed
 659        if fix_negative_volume:
 660            try:
 661                # Check if the mesh has a negative volume
 662                if hasattr(mesh, "volume") and mesh.volume < 0:
 663                    initial_volume = mesh.volume
 664                    mesh.invert()
 665                    repair_log.append(
 666                        f"Inverted faces to fix negative volume: {initial_volume:.2f} → {mesh.volume:.2f}"
 667                    )
 668            except Exception as e:
 669                repair_log.append(f"Failed to fix negative volume: {e}")
 670
 671        # Remove duplicate and degenerate faces
 672        if remove_duplicates:
 673            try:
 674                initial_faces = len(mesh.faces)
 675                mesh.remove_duplicate_faces()
 676                removed_faces = initial_faces - len(mesh.faces)
 677                if removed_faces > 0:
 678                    repair_log.append(f"Removed {removed_faces} duplicate faces")
 679            except Exception as e:
 680                repair_log.append(f"Failed to remove duplicate faces: {e}")
 681
 682        if remove_degenerate:
 683            try:
 684                initial_faces = len(mesh.faces)
 685                mesh.remove_degenerate_faces()
 686                removed_faces = initial_faces - len(mesh.faces)
 687                if removed_faces > 0:
 688                    repair_log.append(f"Removed {removed_faces} degenerate faces")
 689            except Exception as e:
 690                repair_log.append(f"Failed to remove degenerate faces: {e}")
 691
 692        # Fix winding consistency
 693        if fix_normals:
 694            try:
 695                if not mesh.is_winding_consistent:
 696                    mesh.fix_normals()
 697                    if mesh.is_winding_consistent:
 698                        repair_log.append("Fixed face normal winding consistency")
 699                    else:
 700                        repair_log.append(
 701                            "Attempted to fix normals but still inconsistent"
 702                        )
 703            except Exception as e:
 704                repair_log.append(f"Failed to fix normals: {e}")
 705
 706        # Attempt to fill holes
 707        if fix_holes:
 708            try:
 709                if not mesh.is_watertight:
 710                    initial_watertight = mesh.is_watertight
 711                    mesh.fill_holes()
 712                    if mesh.is_watertight and not initial_watertight:
 713                        repair_log.append(
 714                            "Successfully filled holes - mesh is now watertight"
 715                        )
 716                    elif mesh.is_watertight:
 717                        repair_log.append("Mesh was already watertight")
 718                    else:
 719                        repair_log.append(
 720                            "Attempted to fill holes but mesh still not watertight"
 721                        )
 722            except Exception as e:
 723                repair_log.append(f"Failed to fill holes: {e}")
 724
 725        # Keep only the largest component if requested
 726        if keep_largest_component:
 727            try:
 728                components = mesh.split(only_watertight=False)
 729                if len(components) > 1:
 730                    # Keep the largest component by volume or face count
 731                    volumes = [
 732                        abs(c.volume) if hasattr(c, "volume") else len(c.faces)
 733                        for c in components
 734                    ]
 735                    largest_idx = np.argmax(volumes)
 736                    mesh = components[largest_idx]
 737                    repair_log.append(
 738                        f"Kept largest of {len(components)} components (volume: {volumes[largest_idx]:.2f})"
 739                    )
 740            except Exception as e:
 741                repair_log.append(f"Failed to isolate largest component: {e}")
 742
 743        # Final processing to ensure consistency
 744        try:
 745            mesh.process(validate=True)
 746            repair_log.append("Applied final mesh processing and validation")
 747        except Exception as e:
 748            repair_log.append(f"Final processing failed: {e}")
 749
 750        # Store repair log as mesh metadata
 751        if not hasattr(mesh, "metadata"):
 752            mesh.metadata = {}
 753        mesh.metadata["repair_log"] = repair_log
 754
 755        # Log repair summary
 756        if verbose:
 757            if repair_log:
 758                logger.info("Mesh Repair Summary:")
 759                for log_entry in repair_log:
 760                    logger.info("  • %s", log_entry)
 761
 762                # Final mesh status
 763                logger.info("\nFinal Mesh Status:")
 764                logger.info(
 765                    "  • Volume: %s",
 766                    mesh.volume if hasattr(mesh, "volume") else "N/A",
 767                )
 768                logger.info("  • Watertight: %s", mesh.is_watertight)
 769                logger.info("  • Winding consistent: %s", mesh.is_winding_consistent)
 770                logger.info("  • Faces: %d", len(mesh.faces))
 771                logger.info("  • Vertices: %d", len(mesh.vertices))
 772            else:
 773                logger.info("No repairs needed - mesh is in good condition")
 774
 775        self.mesh = mesh
 776        return mesh
 777
 778    def repair_mesh_pymeshfix(
 779        self,
 780        join_components: bool = True,
 781        remove_small_components: bool = False,
 782        keep_largest_component: bool = True,
 783        min_component_faces: int = 30,
 784        verbose: bool = True,
 785        safe: bool = False,
 786        timeout: float = 120.0,
 787    ) -> trimesh.Trimesh:
 788        """Repair current mesh using PyMeshFix.
 789
 790        Args:
 791            join_components: Merge nearby components during repair.
 792            remove_small_components: Remove very small components (PyMeshFix behavior).
 793            keep_largest_component: After repair, keep only the largest connected component.
 794            min_component_faces: Minimum faces to consider a component when filtering.
 795            verbose: Whether to print concise summary (unused here but kept for API symmetry).
 796            safe: Run PyMeshFix in a separate process to avoid hard interpreter exits.
 797            timeout: Seconds to wait for PyMeshFix before aborting.
 798
 799        Returns:
 800            Repaired mesh (also assigned to `self.mesh`).
 801        """
 802        if self.mesh is None:
 803            raise ValueError("No mesh loaded")
 804
 805        try:
 806            from pymeshfix import MeshFix  # type: ignore
 807        except Exception as e:
 808            raise ImportError(
 809                "pymeshfix is required for repair_mesh_pymeshfix; install with `uv pip install pymeshfix`."
 810            ) from e
 811
 812        m = self.mesh
 813        v = np.asarray(m.vertices, dtype=np.float64)
 814        f = np.asarray(m.faces, dtype=np.int64)
 815
 816        # Run PyMeshFix either inline (unsafe) or in a separate process (safe)
 817        if safe:
 818            ctx = multiprocessing.get_context("spawn")
 819            queue: multiprocessing.queues.Queue = ctx.Queue()
 820            proc = ctx.Process(
 821                target=_pymeshfix_worker,
 822                args=(
 823                    queue,
 824                    v,
 825                    f,
 826                    bool(join_components),
 827                    bool(remove_small_components),
 828                    bool(verbose),
 829                ),
 830            )
 831            proc.start()
 832            proc.join(timeout)
 833
 834            if proc.is_alive():
 835                # Timed out
 836                proc.terminate()
 837                proc.join()
 838                raise RuntimeError(f"PyMeshFix timed out after {timeout} seconds")
 839
 840            # Retrieve results from queue
 841            if not queue.empty():
 842                msg = queue.get()
 843            else:
 844                # Likely a hard crash in the child
 845                raise RuntimeError(
 846                    f"PyMeshFix crashed (exit code {proc.exitcode}) with no result"
 847                )
 848
 849            if not msg or msg[0] != "ok":
 850                # msg could be ("err", error_str, traceback)
 851                detail = (
 852                    msg[1]
 853                    if isinstance(msg, tuple) and len(msg) > 1
 854                    else "unknown error"
 855                )
 856                raise RuntimeError(f"PyMeshFix failed: {detail}")
 857
 858            _, v2, f2 = msg
 859        else:
 860            mf = MeshFix(v, f)
 861            try:
 862                mf.repair(
 863                    verbose=verbose,
 864                    joincomp=bool(join_components),
 865                    remove_small_components=bool(remove_small_components),
 866                )
 867            except TypeError:
 868                # Older signature without keywords
 869                mf.repair()
 870
 871            v2 = np.asarray(getattr(mf, "v", None), dtype=np.float64)
 872            f2 = np.asarray(getattr(mf, "f", None), dtype=np.int64)
 873            if v2.size == 0 or f2.size == 0:
 874                raise ValueError("PyMeshFix returned an empty mesh")
 875
 876        repaired = trimesh.Trimesh(vertices=v2, faces=f2, process=True)
 877        # Post-process: fix normals, validate
 878        try:
 879            if not repaired.is_winding_consistent:
 880                repaired.fix_normals()
 881            repaired.process(validate=True)
 882        except Exception:
 883            pass
 884
 885        # Optionally keep largest component
 886        if keep_largest_component:
 887            try:
 888                comps = repaired.split(only_watertight=False)
 889                if len(comps) > 1:
 890
 891                    def comp_key(c: trimesh.Trimesh):
 892                        vol = abs(float(getattr(c, "volume", 0.0)))
 893                        return (vol, len(c.faces))
 894
 895                    comps_filtered = [
 896                        c for c in comps if len(c.faces) >= int(min_component_faces)
 897                    ]
 898                    use = comps_filtered if comps_filtered else comps
 899                    repaired = max(use, key=comp_key)
 900                    repaired.process(validate=True)
 901            except Exception:
 902                pass
 903
 904        self.mesh = repaired
 905        return repaired
 906
 907    def visualize_mesh_3d(
 908        self,
 909        title: str = "3D Mesh Visualization",
 910        color: str = "lightblue",
 911        backend: str = "auto",
 912        show_axes: bool = True,
 913        show_wireframe: bool = False,
 914        width: int = 800,
 915        height: int = 600,
 916    ) -> Optional[object]:
 917        """
 918        Create a 3D visualization of a mesh.
 919
 920        Args:
 921            title: Plot title
 922            color: Mesh color (named color or RGB tuple)
 923            backend: Visualization backend ('plotly' or 'matplotlib')
 924            show_axes: Whether to show coordinate axes
 925            show_wireframe: Whether to show wireframe overlay
 926
 927        Returns:
 928            Figure object (backend-dependent) or None if visualization fails
 929        """
 930        if backend == "auto":
 931            # Try plotly first, then fallback to others
 932            try:
 933                import plotly.graph_objects as go
 934
 935                backend = "plotly"
 936            except ImportError:
 937                try:
 938                    import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
 939
 940                    backend = "matplotlib"
 941                except ImportError:
 942                    backend = "plotly"
 943
 944        if backend == "plotly":
 945            return self._visualize_mesh_plotly(
 946                title, color, show_axes, show_wireframe, width, height
 947            )
 948        elif backend == "matplotlib":
 949            return self._visualize_mesh_matplotlib(
 950                title, color, show_axes, show_wireframe
 951            )
 952        else:
 953            raise ValueError(f"Unknown backend: {backend}")
 954
 955    def _visualize_mesh_plotly(
 956        self, title, color, show_axes, show_wireframe, width=800, height=600
 957    ):
 958        """Plotly-based mesh visualization."""
 959        try:
 960            import plotly.graph_objects as go
 961
 962            vertices = self.mesh.vertices
 963            faces = self.mesh.faces
 964
 965            # Create mesh trace
 966            mesh_trace = go.Mesh3d(
 967                x=vertices[:, 0],
 968                y=vertices[:, 1],
 969                z=vertices[:, 2],
 970                i=faces[:, 0],
 971                j=faces[:, 1],
 972                k=faces[:, 2],
 973                opacity=0.8,
 974                color=color,
 975                name="Mesh",
 976            )
 977
 978            fig = go.Figure(data=[mesh_trace])
 979
 980            # Add wireframe if requested
 981            if show_wireframe:
 982                # Create wireframe edges
 983                edge_trace = []
 984                for face in faces:
 985                    for i in range(3):
 986                        v1, v2 = face[i], face[(i + 1) % 3]
 987                        edge_trace.extend(
 988                            [
 989                                vertices[v1][0],
 990                                vertices[v2][0],
 991                                None,
 992                                vertices[v1][1],
 993                                vertices[v2][1],
 994                                None,
 995                                vertices[v1][2],
 996                                vertices[v2][2],
 997                                None,
 998                            ]
 999                        )
1000
1001                if edge_trace:
1002                    fig.add_trace(
1003                        go.Scatter3d(
1004                            x=edge_trace[::3],
1005                            y=edge_trace[1::3],
1006                            z=edge_trace[2::3],
1007                            mode="lines",
1008                            line=dict(color="black", width=1),
1009                            name="Wireframe",
1010                        )
1011                    )
1012
1013            # Configure layout
1014            fig.update_layout(
1015                title=title,
1016                autosize=False,
1017                width=width,
1018                height=height,
1019                scene=dict(
1020                    aspectmode="data",
1021                    xaxis=dict(visible=show_axes),
1022                    yaxis=dict(visible=show_axes),
1023                    zaxis=dict(visible=show_axes),
1024                ),
1025            )
1026
1027            return fig
1028
1029        except ImportError:
1030            print("Plotly not available")
1031            return None
1032        except Exception as e:
1033            print(f"Plotly visualization failed: {e}")
1034            return None
1035
1036    def _visualize_mesh_matplotlib(self, title, color, show_axes, show_wireframe):
1037        """Matplotlib-based mesh visualization."""
1038        try:
1039            import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
1040            from mpl_toolkits.mplot3d.art3d import Poly3DCollection
1041
1042            fig = plt.figure(figsize=(10, 8))
1043            ax = fig.add_subplot(111, projection="3d")
1044
1045            vertices = self.mesh.vertices
1046            faces = self.mesh.faces
1047
1048            # Create mesh surface
1049            poly3d = Poly3DCollection(
1050                vertices[faces],
1051                alpha=0.7,
1052                facecolor=color,
1053                edgecolor="black" if show_wireframe else None,
1054            )
1055            ax.add_collection3d(poly3d)
1056
1057            ax.set_xlim(vertices[:, 0].min(), vertices[:, 0].max())
1058            ax.set_ylim(vertices[:, 1].min(), vertices[:, 1].max())
1059            ax.set_zlim(vertices[:, 2].min(), vertices[:, 2].max())
1060
1061            ax.set_xlabel("X (µm)")
1062            ax.set_ylabel("Y (µm)")
1063            ax.set_zlabel("Z (µm)")
1064            ax.set_title(title)
1065
1066            if not show_axes:
1067                ax.set_axis_off()
1068
1069            plt.tight_layout()
1070            return fig
1071
1072        except ImportError:
1073            print("Matplotlib not available")
1074            return None
1075        except Exception as e:
1076            print(f"Matplotlib visualization failed: {e}")
1077            return None
1078
1079    def visualize_mesh_slice_interactive(
1080        self,
1081        title: str = "Interactive Mesh Slice",
1082        z_range: Optional[Tuple[float, float]] = None,
1083        num_slices: int = 50,
1084        slice_color: str = "red",
1085        mesh_color: str = "lightblue",
1086        mesh_opacity: float = 0.3,
1087    ) -> Optional[object]:
1088        """
1089        Create an interactive 3D visualization of a mesh with a controllable slice plane.
1090
1091        This function displays a 3D mesh and calculates the intersection of the mesh
1092        with an xy-plane at a user-controlled z-value. The intersection is shown as a
1093        colored line on the mesh. A slider allows the user to interactively change the
1094        z-value of the intersection plane.
1095
1096        Args:
1097            title: Plot title
1098            z_range: Tuple of (min_z, max_z) for slice range. Auto-detected if None.
1099            num_slices: Number of positions for the slider
1100            slice_color: Color for the intersection line
1101            mesh_color: Color for the 3D mesh
1102            mesh_opacity: Opacity of the 3D mesh (0-1)
1103
1104        Returns:
1105            Plotly figure with interactive slider for controlling the z-value
1106        """
1107        try:
1108            import plotly.graph_objects as go
1109        except ImportError:
1110            print("Plotly is required for interactive visualization")
1111            return None
1112
1113        mesh = self.mesh
1114
1115        # Determine z-range if not provided
1116        if z_range is None:
1117            z_min, z_max = mesh.vertices[:, 2].min(), mesh.vertices[:, 2].max()
1118            # Add small padding
1119            padding = (z_max - z_min) * 0.05
1120            z_min -= padding
1121            z_max += padding
1122        else:
1123            z_min, z_max = z_range
1124
1125        # Create the base figure with the mesh
1126        fig = go.Figure()
1127
1128        # Add the mesh to the figure
1129        fig.add_trace(
1130            go.Mesh3d(
1131                x=mesh.vertices[:, 0],
1132                y=mesh.vertices[:, 1],
1133                z=mesh.vertices[:, 2],
1134                i=mesh.faces[:, 0],
1135                j=mesh.faces[:, 1],
1136                k=mesh.faces[:, 2],
1137                opacity=mesh_opacity,
1138                color=mesh_color,
1139                name="Mesh",
1140            )
1141        )
1142
1143        # Function to create a slice at a given z-value
1144        def create_slice_trace(z_value):
1145            # Calculate intersection with plane at z_value
1146            section = mesh.section(plane_origin=[0, 0, z_value], plane_normal=[0, 0, 1])
1147
1148            # If no intersection, return None
1149            if (
1150                section is None
1151                or not hasattr(section, "entities")
1152                or len(section.entities) == 0
1153            ):
1154                return None
1155
1156            # Process all entities in the section to get 3D coordinates
1157            all_points = []
1158
1159            for entity in section.entities:
1160                if hasattr(entity, "points") and len(entity.points) > 0:
1161                    # Get the actual 2D coordinates
1162                    points_2d = section.vertices[entity.points]
1163
1164                    # Convert to 3D by adding z_value
1165                    points_3d = np.column_stack(
1166                        [points_2d, np.full(len(points_2d), z_value)]
1167                    )
1168
1169                    # Add closing point if needed (to complete the loop)
1170                    if len(points_2d) > 2 and not np.array_equal(
1171                        points_2d[0], points_2d[-1]
1172                    ):
1173                        closing_point = np.array(
1174                            [points_2d[0][0], points_2d[0][1], z_value]
1175                        )
1176                        points_3d = np.vstack([points_3d, closing_point])
1177
1178                    # Add to all points list
1179                    all_points.extend(points_3d.tolist())
1180
1181                    # Add None to create a break between separate entities
1182                    all_points.append([None, None, None])
1183
1184            # If we have points, create a scatter trace
1185            if all_points:
1186                x_coords = [p[0] if p is not None else None for p in all_points]
1187                y_coords = [p[1] if p is not None else None for p in all_points]
1188                z_coords = [p[2] if p is not None else None for p in all_points]
1189
1190                return go.Scatter3d(
1191                    x=x_coords,
1192                    y=y_coords,
1193                    z=z_coords,
1194                    mode="lines",
1195                    line=dict(color=slice_color, width=5),
1196                    name=f"Slice at z={z_value:.2f}",
1197                )
1198
1199            return None
1200
1201        # Create initial slice
1202        initial_z = (z_min + z_max) / 2
1203        initial_slice = create_slice_trace(initial_z)
1204
1205        # Add initial slice to figure if it exists
1206        if initial_slice:
1207            fig.add_trace(initial_slice)
1208
1209        # Create frames for animation
1210        frames = []
1211        for i, z_val in enumerate(np.linspace(z_min, z_max, num_slices)):
1212            # Create a slice at this z-value
1213            slice_trace = create_slice_trace(z_val)
1214
1215            # If we have a valid slice, add it to frames
1216            if slice_trace:
1217                frame_data = [fig.data[0], slice_trace]  # Mesh and slice
1218            else:
1219                frame_data = [fig.data[0]]  # Just the mesh
1220
1221            frames.append(
1222                go.Frame(
1223                    data=frame_data,
1224                    name=f"frame_{i}",
1225                    traces=[0, 1],  # Update both traces
1226                )
1227            )
1228
1229        # Create slider steps
1230        steps = []
1231        for i, z_val in enumerate(np.linspace(z_min, z_max, num_slices)):
1232            step = dict(
1233                args=[
1234                    [f"frame_{i}"],
1235                    {"frame": {"duration": 0, "redraw": True}, "mode": "immediate"},
1236                ],
1237                label=f"{z_val:.2f}",
1238                method="animate",
1239            )
1240            steps.append(step)
1241
1242        # Configure the slider
1243        sliders = [
1244            dict(
1245                active=num_slices // 2,  # Start in the middle
1246                currentvalue={
1247                    "prefix": "Z-value: ",
1248                    "visible": True,
1249                    "xanchor": "right",
1250                },
1251                pad={"t": 50, "b": 10},
1252                len=0.9,
1253                x=0.1,
1254                y=0,
1255                steps=steps,
1256            )
1257        ]
1258
1259        # Configure the figure layout
1260        fig.update_layout(
1261            title=title,
1262            scene=dict(aspectmode="data", camera=dict(eye=dict(x=1.5, y=1.5, z=1.5))),
1263            height=800,  # Taller to make room for slider
1264            margin=dict(l=50, r=50, b=100, t=100),  # Add margin at bottom for slider
1265            sliders=sliders,
1266            # Add animation controls
1267            updatemenus=[
1268                dict(
1269                    type="buttons",
1270                    showactive=False,
1271                    y=0,
1272                    x=0,
1273                    xanchor="left",
1274                    yanchor="top",
1275                    pad=dict(t=60, r=10),
1276                    buttons=[
1277                        dict(
1278                            label="Play",
1279                            method="animate",
1280                            args=[
1281                                None,
1282                                {
1283                                    "frame": {"duration": 200, "redraw": True},
1284                                    "fromcurrent": True,
1285                                },
1286                            ],
1287                        ),
1288                        dict(
1289                            label="Pause",
1290                            method="animate",
1291                            args=[
1292                                [None],
1293                                {
1294                                    "frame": {"duration": 0, "redraw": False},
1295                                    "mode": "immediate",
1296                                },
1297                            ],
1298                        ),
1299                        dict(
1300                            label="Reset View",
1301                            method="relayout",
1302                            args=[{"scene.camera.eye": dict(x=1.5, y=1.5, z=1.5)}],
1303                        ),
1304                    ],
1305                )
1306            ],
1307        )
1308
1309        # Set frames
1310        fig.frames = frames
1311
1312        return fig
1313
1314    def visualize_mesh_slice_grid(
1315        self,
1316        vertices: Optional[np.ndarray] = None,
1317        faces: Optional[np.ndarray] = None,
1318        title: str = "Mesh Slice Grid",
1319        num_slices: int = 9,
1320        z_range: Optional[Tuple[float, float]] = None,
1321    ) -> Optional[object]:
1322        """
1323        Create a grid visualization showing multiple cross-sections of a 3D mesh.
1324
1325        Args:
1326            vertices: Vertex array (alternative to mesh_data)
1327            faces: Face array (alternative to mesh_data)
1328            title: Plot title
1329            num_slices: Number of slices to show (should be perfect square for grid)
1330            z_range: Tuple of (min_z, max_z) for slice range. Auto-detected if None.
1331
1332        Returns:
1333            Plotly figure with subplot grid
1334        """
1335        try:
1336            import math
1337
1338            import plotly.graph_objects as go
1339            from plotly.subplots import make_subplots
1340        except ImportError:
1341            print("Plotly not available for slice grid visualization")
1342            return None
1343
1344        mesh = self.mesh
1345
1346        # Determine grid size
1347        grid_size = int(math.sqrt(num_slices))
1348        if grid_size * grid_size != num_slices:
1349            grid_size = int(math.ceil(math.sqrt(num_slices)))
1350            num_slices = grid_size * grid_size
1351
1352        # Determine Z range
1353        if z_range is None:
1354            z_min, z_max = mesh.vertices[:, 2].min(), mesh.vertices[:, 2].max()
1355        else:
1356            z_min, z_max = z_range
1357
1358        # Create Z levels
1359        z_levels = np.linspace(z_min, z_max, num_slices)
1360
1361        # Create subplots
1362        fig = make_subplots(
1363            rows=grid_size,
1364            cols=grid_size,
1365            subplot_titles=[f"Z = {z:.2f}" for z in z_levels],
1366            specs=[[{"type": "xy"}] * grid_size for _ in range(grid_size)],
1367        )
1368
1369        # Generate slices and add to subplots
1370        for i, z_level in enumerate(z_levels):
1371            row = i // grid_size + 1
1372            col = i % grid_size + 1
1373
1374            try:
1375                # Get 2D cross-section
1376                slice_2d = mesh.section(
1377                    plane_origin=[0, 0, z_level], plane_normal=[0, 0, 1]
1378                )
1379
1380                if (
1381                    slice_2d is not None
1382                    and hasattr(slice_2d, "entities")
1383                    and len(slice_2d.entities) > 0
1384                ):
1385                    # Plot each entity in the slice
1386                    for entity in slice_2d.entities:
1387                        if hasattr(entity, "points"):
1388                            points = slice_2d.vertices[entity.points]
1389                            # Close the loop
1390                            points_closed = np.vstack([points, points[0]])
1391
1392                            fig.add_trace(
1393                                go.Scatter(
1394                                    x=points_closed[:, 0],
1395                                    y=points_closed[:, 1],
1396                                    mode="lines",
1397                                    line=dict(color="red", width=2),
1398                                    showlegend=False,
1399                                ),
1400                                row=row,
1401                                col=col,
1402                            )
1403
1404                # Set equal aspect ratio for each subplot
1405                fig.update_xaxes(scaleanchor="y", scaleratio=1, row=row, col=col)
1406                fig.update_xaxes(title_text="X (µm)", row=row, col=col)
1407                fig.update_yaxes(title_text="Y (µm)", row=row, col=col)
1408
1409            except Exception as e:
1410                # If slicing fails, just leave subplot empty
1411                pass
1412
1413        fig.update_layout(
1414            title=title,
1415            height=150 * grid_size,
1416            showlegend=False,
1417        )
1418
1419        return fig
1420
1421    def slice_mesh_by_z(
1422        self,
1423        z: float,
1424        cap: bool = True,
1425        validate: bool = True,
1426    ) -> Tuple[Optional[trimesh.Trimesh], Optional[trimesh.Trimesh]]:
1427        """
1428        Slice the current mesh with the horizontal plane z = value and return
1429        two new meshes partitioned along that plane.
1430
1431        This creates new vertices where the plane intersects the original mesh
1432        and (optionally) caps the cut so both results are closed.
1433
1434        Args:
1435            z: Z-value of the slicing plane (plane origin [0, 0, z], normal [0, 0, 1]).
1436            cap: If True, seal the open cut by adding faces.
1437            validate: If True, run trimesh processing/validation on the results.
1438
1439        Returns:
1440            (below_mesh, above_mesh):
1441                below_mesh contains the portion with vertices at z <= value.
1442                above_mesh contains the portion with vertices at z >= value.
1443                Either may be None if the plane lies completely outside the mesh.
1444        """
1445        if self.mesh is None:
1446            raise ValueError("No mesh loaded")
1447
1448        plane_origin = np.array([0.0, 0.0, float(z)])
1449        plane_normal = np.array([0.0, 0.0, 1.0])
1450
1451        below_mesh: Optional[trimesh.Trimesh]
1452        above_mesh: Optional[trimesh.Trimesh]
1453
1454        # Positive side (normal pointing +Z) yields z >= z_plane -> above
1455        try:
1456            above_mesh = trimesh.intersections.slice_mesh_plane(
1457                self.mesh, plane_normal=plane_normal, plane_origin=plane_origin, cap=cap
1458            )
1459        except Exception:
1460            above_mesh = None
1461
1462        # Reverse normal yields z <= z_plane -> below
1463        try:
1464            below_mesh = trimesh.intersections.slice_mesh_plane(
1465                self.mesh,
1466                plane_normal=-plane_normal,
1467                plane_origin=plane_origin,
1468                cap=cap,
1469            )
1470        except Exception:
1471            below_mesh = None
1472
1473        # Normalize empty results to None
1474        if isinstance(above_mesh, trimesh.Trimesh) and (
1475            len(above_mesh.faces) == 0 or len(above_mesh.vertices) == 0
1476        ):
1477            above_mesh = None
1478        if isinstance(below_mesh, trimesh.Trimesh) and (
1479            len(below_mesh.faces) == 0 or len(below_mesh.vertices) == 0
1480        ):
1481            below_mesh = None
1482
1483        # Optionally validate/process
1484        if validate:
1485            if isinstance(above_mesh, trimesh.Trimesh):
1486                try:
1487                    above_mesh.process(validate=True)
1488                except Exception:
1489                    pass
1490            if isinstance(below_mesh, trimesh.Trimesh):
1491                try:
1492                    below_mesh.process(validate=True)
1493                except Exception:
1494                    pass
1495
1496        # Attach metadata
1497        if isinstance(above_mesh, trimesh.Trimesh):
1498            if not hasattr(above_mesh, "metadata") or above_mesh.metadata is None:
1499                above_mesh.metadata = {}
1500            above_mesh.metadata.update({"sliced_by_z": float(z), "side": "above"})
1501
1502        if isinstance(below_mesh, trimesh.Trimesh):
1503            if not hasattr(below_mesh, "metadata") or below_mesh.metadata is None:
1504                below_mesh.metadata = {}
1505            below_mesh.metadata.update({"sliced_by_z": float(z), "side": "below"})
1506
1507        return below_mesh, above_mesh

Unified mesh class handling loading, processing, and analysis.

def log(self, message: str, level: str = 'INFO'): 
78    def log(self, message: str, level: str = "INFO"):
79        """Compatibility shim: delegate to module logger respecting self.verbose.
80
81        Levels: INFO, SUCCESS (maps to INFO), WARNING, ERROR, PROCESSING (maps to INFO)
82        """
83        if not self.verbose:
84            return
85        lvl = level.upper()
86        if lvl in ("SUCCESS", "PROCESSING"):
87            lvl = "INFO"
88        if lvl == "INFO":
89            logger.info(message)
90        elif lvl == "WARNING":
91            logger.warning(message)
92        elif lvl == "ERROR":
93            logger.error(message)
94        else:
95            logger.info(message)

def load_mesh( self, filepath: str, file_format: Optional[str] = None) -> trimesh.base.Trimesh: 
101    def load_mesh(
102        self, filepath: str, file_format: Optional[str] = None
103    ) -> trimesh.Trimesh:
104        """
105        Load a mesh from file.
106
107        Args:
108            filepath: Path to mesh file
109            file_format: Optional format specification (auto-detected if None)
110
111        Returns:
112            Loaded trimesh object
113        """
114        try:
115            if file_format:
116                mesh = trimesh.load(filepath, file_type=file_format)
117            else:
118                mesh = trimesh.load(filepath)
119
120            # Ensure we have a single mesh
121            if isinstance(mesh, trimesh.Scene):
122                # If it's a scene, try to get the first geometry
123                geometries = list(mesh.geometry.values())
124                if geometries:
125                    mesh = geometries[0]
126                else:
127                    raise ValueError("No geometry found in mesh scene")
128
129            if not isinstance(mesh, trimesh.Trimesh):
130                raise ValueError(f"Loaded object is not a mesh: {type(mesh)}")
131
132            self.mesh = mesh
133            self.original_mesh = mesh.copy()
134            self.bounds = self._compute_bounds()
135
136            if self.verbose:
137                logger.info(
138                    "Loaded mesh: %d vertices, %d faces",
139                    len(mesh.vertices),
140                    len(mesh.faces),
141                )
142                logger.debug("Bounds: %s", self.bounds)
143
144            return mesh
145
146        except Exception as e:
147            raise ValueError(f"Failed to load mesh from {filepath}: {str(e)}")

def center_mesh(self, center_on: str = 'centroid') -> trimesh.base.Trimesh: 
178    def center_mesh(self, center_on: str = "centroid") -> trimesh.Trimesh:
179        """
180        Center the mesh.
181
182        Args:
183            center_on: 'centroid', 'bounds_center', or 'origin'
184
185        Returns:
186            Centered mesh
187        """
188        if self.mesh is None:
189            raise ValueError("No mesh loaded")
190
191        if center_on == "centroid":
192            center = self.mesh.centroid
193        elif center_on == "bounds_center":
194            center = self.mesh.bounds.mean(axis=0)
195        elif center_on == "origin":
196            center = np.array([0, 0, 0])
197        else:
198            raise ValueError(f"Unknown center_on option: {center_on}")
199
200        self.mesh.vertices -= center
201        self.bounds = self._compute_bounds()
202
203        return self.mesh

Returns: Centered mesh
